result.execSummary:
The defendant Dennis Schwartz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay Restitution of $231.31, to Campus Cycle Sport Shop. This is to be paid first, and then the costs of the action.

Pay costs, DNA surcharges, and warrant fees. If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
If all conditions are met and with recommendation by the agent, Defendant is eligible for early discharge.

records.addlTxt:
Final Reminder Notice with request to pay in full or set up payment plan has been sent to the Defendant's address in the file as of this date. 
Failure to pay or set up payment plan--warrant to be issued.
Restitution: $232.08

10:23 a.m. Defendant Dennis Schwartz in court with attorney Acalia N Kleven. Defendant Dennis Schwartz in custody. Louis John Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties have received and reviewed the Revocation packet from DOC. DA Molepske states recommendation. Atty Kleven concurs with the joint recommendation, 178 days credit.  Defendant makes apologetic statement.
BY THE COURT:**Jail**
180 days jail - Time served
Civil Judgment for $232.08 Restitution.
Pay costs and convert to civil judgment.
  Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan today for costs and restitution.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dennis Schwartz in court with attorney Acalia N Halverson. Defendant Dennis Schwartz in custody. Louis John Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:59 AM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

Matter is set for a plea and sentencing.

Court has a signed Plea questionnaire/Agreement.

There is a plea agreement.
Defendant will plead to single count.

State recommends 12 months probation with conditions. 

State provides a restitution summary to the Court.

Atty Halverson concurs.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST.

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Halverson for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: Issuance of worthless checks

Atty Molepske makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
State has complied with victim notification statues.
Atty Halverson makes sentencing arguments to the Court, this is a joint recommendation. 

Court believes the joint recommendation is appropriate for reasons stated by counsel.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1:
Sentence is Withheld
Probation for a period of 12 Months
Conditions:
Pay Restitution of $231.31, to Campus Cycle Sport Shop. This is to be paid first, and then the costs of the action.
Pay warrant fee of $30
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Court will give Defendant time to pay. Defendant is to work out a plan with the clerk or pay within 60 days.
Perform 20 Hours of Community Service, preferrably with the Portage County Parks Department
Do not own a checking account 
If all conditions are met and with recommendation by the agent, Defendant is eligible for early discharge
/s/ RJS
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 16, 2016 at 09:45 am.
